hiveArticle.title: Hacktoberfest - Have you signed up?
hiveArticle.body:
Hacktoberfest happening in the month of October is a  celebration where it encourages people to work on open-source projects run by DigitalOcean in partnership with DEV.

According to their [website]( https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/)

>Hacktoberfest is open to everyone in our global community. Whether youâ€™re a developer, student learning to code, event host, or the company of any size, you can help drive the growth of open source and make positive contributions to an ever-growing community. All backgrounds and skill levels are encouraged to complete the challenge.

The rules are simple, you just need to create 4 PRs (Pull Request) in any of the open-source repo and thus you are entitled to receive limited edition Hacktoberfest t-shirt. Do note that only the first 50,000 participants who successfully complete the challenge will get a t-shirt.

Once you complete 4 PRs, you need to wait for another 7 days for the review period. Once the review period is over you will be officially complete the challenge to get a t-shirt and swag.

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmVqaaDiyHDr97MHoUMBTMZhxmpQPYV4hHhsWfV4VQq9nj/image.png)

Many companies joined the celebration by rewarding their contributors with even more swag which can be viewed [here](https://github.com/benbarth/hacktoberfest-swag/blob/master/README.md).

Now the question arises why you should contribute, it's not only for the t-shirt you will earn. We use a lot of open-source software in our daily life (steem being one), by contributing we are just giving back to the community. 

If you want to start and looking for a project, do let me know. I will help you find a project.
